results.title: Private life of a silkworm
results.brief_description: Covers all phases in the production of natural silk; close-ups of silkworm feeding on mulberry leaves; spinning cocoon; mechanical separation of males and females; mating and laying of eggs; removal of silk from cocoons; spinning of individual strands into a thread; weighing and checking hanks; weaving of silk cloth.
results.description: Covers all phases in the production of natural silk; close-ups of silkworm feeding on mulberry leaves; spinning cocoon; mechanical separation of males and females; mating and laying of eggs; removal of silk from cocoons; spinning of individual strands into a thread; weighing and checking hanks; weaving of silk cloth.

results.title: Private life of a cat
results.brief_description: The animal’s outlook on life. The camera lens has been treated as the eyes of a mother cat, observing the daily details of life in a feline family. Thus, an ordinary room becomes an immense foreign environment, in which is enacted the drama of birth - a sequence now celebrated as one of the the most unusual in film literature.

results.title: Private and confidential
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Joe Bogdanov
results.brief_description: It was the first time a boy had kissed me. I felt as though I was reeling, soaring drowning-all at once, I gave myself completely to his lips! So thinks the teenage heroine of this in-depth look at True Romance Comix. The stage is set for Joan’s undoing. Useful for exploring popular culture, sexism and melodrama. Winner, Diploma of Merit, Melbourne Film Festival, 1984.

results.title: Prisoners of propaganda
results.brief_description: In 1943, the Imperial Japanese Army Secret Service forced a group of Australian servicemen to appear in a film to show the “exemplary” conditions under which Prisoners of War were treated by Japan. This program looks at the mysterious story behind that film, titled, Calling Australia.

results.title: Prisoners of incest
results.brief_description: Through the re-enactment, by actors, of a family group therapy session, this program documents the family trauma of incest. Members of the family meet together with a psychiatrist and a social worker to try and sort out their emotional reactions to their problem.

results.title: Prisoners of debt: inside the global banking crisis
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Spotton, John Kramer, Peter Raymont and Robert Collison
results.brief_description: This fast-paced documentary tells the inside story of how Bank of Montreal chairman William Mulholland dealt with his bank’s debt-laden customers, Dome Petroleum and Mexico, during the summer of 1982, the summer the global debt crisis took the world by surprise. Interwoven with the Bank of Montreal’s story are interviews with well-known international bankers and financial experts who explain the causes of the debt crisis, confirm the extreme fragility of the international banking system, and outline the problems to be solved if the system is to survive.

results.title: Prisoners of chance
results.creator_credit: Vitascope Productions, FilmFair Communications, Thom Eberhardt and Marc Stirdivant
results.brief_description: Presents dramatized re-enactments of three case studies of teenage pregnancies: a girl who gives up her baby for adoption when she realizes she cannot cope; a girl who lives with her parents after the birth; and a couple who marries after the girl becomes pregnant. De-romanticises the notion of “Having a baby” by pointing out some commo problems of teenage pregnancies.

results.title: Prisoners
results.creator_credit: Prisoners' Action Group, Tony Green and Mark Stiles
results.brief_description: Uses an innovative mix of interviews, photographs and sketches combined with comprehensive statistical information, to provide a profile on prisoners in New South Wales. Shows who goes to prison, why, and what happens to them inside the gaols. Interviews with ex-prisoners and their families demonstrate the futility of prisons as an answer to social problems. Touches on the destructive fires at Bathurst Jail and the reprisals carried out on prisoners before their transfer.

results.title: Prisoner or patient
results.brief_description: The debate continues: are those guilty of grotesque crimes mentally disturbed or just evil? Should they be locked up and punished, or treated for illness? This documentary examines what happens to thousands of inadequate and sick offenders. It shows how the system works in Britain from courtroom to institution.
results.description: The debate continues: are those guilty of grotesque crimes mentally disturbed or just evil? Should they be locked up and punished, or treated for illness? results.title: Prisoner of the mountains = Kavkazsky Plennik
results.creator_credit: Karavan, BG Productions, Boris Giller and Sergei Bodrov
results.brief_description: By all appearances, ‘Prisoner of the Mountains’ can easily be branded a film about the conflict in Chechnya. In fact, it was conceived well before the beginning of the war and has a short story by Leo Tolstoy, ‘Prisoner of the Caucasus’, as its basis. As the war rages in the Caucasus, young recruit Vania (Sergei Bodrov, Jr.) is sent off to the front, where he befriends a wily and experienced soldier, Sasha (Oleg Menshikov). During an ambush, the pair is captured by Muslims forces and taken prisoner to a mountain village. The leader - Abdel Murat (Djemal Sikharulidze), intends to use the soldiers as exchange currency against his son, held prisoner by the Russian army. As their stay in the village extends, a mutual understanding develops between Vania and Abdel Murat as well as a tender friendship with his daughter. However, Sasha plots to use this new found understanding as a means for achieving freedom. ‘Prisoner of the Mountains’ is a powerful anti-war fable exploring the universal themes of human friendship overcoming, for a luminous moment, the barriers of language, religion, culture and other physical and mental borders. Filmed on location in Daghestan, ‘Prisoner of the Mountains’ was cast mostly with local villager. This visual feast set among stunning mountainous landscape garnered a scoop of awards and nominations, including Best Foreign Film Oscar Nomination (1996) and the Cannes Film Festival Award (1996). In Russian with English subtitles.
